intro: Alectorolophus ellipticus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lily, is a flowering plant belonging to the Liliaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a short stem and grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The flowers bloom in late spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
